text: Ketelaar(left) with Frits Zernike, November 1955. Jan Arnold Albert Ketelaar (21 April 1908 23 November 2001) was a Dutch chemist and author of the textbook Chemical Constitution: an Introduction to the Theory of the Chemical Bond (). Van Arkel–Ketelaar triangles are named after him. Ketelaar was born in Amsterdam and died in Lochem. He was elected a member of the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences in 1958. ==References== Category:1908 births Category:2001 deaths Category:Dutch chemists Category:Members of the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences Category:Scientists from Amsterdam
title: Jan Ketelaar
